column2: [C]  a statement about all the members of a group that may be true in some or many situations but is not true in every case （片面的）概括，泛论
column3: e.g. You can't make [[generalizations]] about what men and women are like.

column2: [C, U] an idea or story that many people believe, but which is not true （许多人相信的）错误观念，荒诞说法
column3: e.g. Contrary to the popular [[myth]], women are not worse drivers than men.

column2: [C] (fml.) a husband or wife 配偶
column3: e.g. Please notice that [[spouses]] are welcome to the company picnic.

column2: (fml.) (only before noun) connected with a husband or wife; of or from a husband or wife 配偶的
column3: e.g. Here are the 10 things you should never say in a [[spousal]] argument.

column2: feeling annoyed and impatient because you cannot do or achieve what you want 懊丧的；懊恼的；沮丧的
column3: e.g. Stacy got so [[frustrated]] that she stood up and walked out of the room.

column2: [U] the state of being logical and true 符合逻辑；正当；正确
column3: e.g. We had serious doubts about the [[validity]] of their argument.

column2: (~ from) develop as a result of sth. else 源于；来自；由···引起
column3: e.g. He told the magazine in an exclusive interview that all his misfortune [[stemmed]] from a lack of tolerance toward others.

column2: [C]（植物的）茎，梗，柄
column3: e.g. He told the magazine in an exclusive interview that all his misfortune [[stemmed]] from a lack of tolerance toward others.

column2: go around searching for food or other supplies （为找到食物、补给等）四处搜寻
column3: e.g. When it's cold and snowy outside, birds may [[forage]] for food in your backyard.

column2: [C] (pl. millennia ) a period of 1,000 years 一千年；千年期
column3: e.g. The year 2000 was celebrated as the beginning of the third [[millennium]].

column2: based on instinct, not thought or training 本能的；直觉的；天性的
column3: e.g. Animals provide the best examples of [[instinctive]] behavior.

column2: [C] (fml.) a particular way or style of behaving, living, or doing sth. 方式；方法；做法
column3: e.g. Many children recognize that cycling and walking are environmentally-friendly [[modes]] of transportation.

column2: [U] the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth 营养（作用）；滋养
column3: e.g. It is widely known that [[nutrition]] and exercise are essential to fitness and health.

column2: (of food) containing many of the substances which help the body to grow （食物）有营养的，营养丰富的
column3: e.g. The cookbook contains many simple yet highly [[nutritious]] meals.

column2: fit or suitable to be eaten; not poisonous 适宜食用的；（无毒而）可以吃的
column3: e.g. There are many [[edible]] fruits growing wild in the coastal forest.

column2: get rid of sth. 扔掉；弃置
column3: e.g. Would you help me remove the seeds from the melon and [[discard]] them?

column2: heavily loaded with sth. 载满的；装满的
column3: e.g. He was surprised to find that the tables were [[laden]] with food.

column2: [U, sing.] the traditional beliefs, values, customs, etc. of a family, country, or society （文化）遗产；传统
column3: e.g. These works of art are of great importance to Russia's national [[heritage]].

column2: relating to the time in history before anything was written down 史前的；有历史记载以前的
column3: e.g. We do not have to go back to [[prehistoric]] times to witness the change in our diet.

column2: 1) [C] sth. that you buy or obtain, often to add to things that you already have 购置物；获得物
column3: e.g. The Art Society is holding an exhibition of recent [[acquisitions]].；e.g. We need to recognize that second language [[acquisition]] is a gradual developmental process.

column2: 2) [U] the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill （知识、技能的）获得，习得
column3: e.g. The Art Society is holding an exhibition of recent [[acquisitions]].；e.g. We need to recognize that second language [[acquisition]] is a gradual developmental process.

column2: (of the air or climate) warm and damp （空气或气候）温暖潮湿的，湿热的
column3: e.g. It was a hot, [[humid]] day, and the only sound was the buzzing of insects.

column2: [C] (fml.) a particular quality in sb.'s character （某人性格中的）特性，品质
column3: e.g. It's a human [[trait]] to joke about subjects that make us uncomfortable.

column2: [C] an inclination toward a particular characteristic or type of behavior 趋势；趋向；倾向
column3: e.g. For students, there is a [[tendency]] to socialize in the evenings.

column2: [C] a person who studies anthropology 人类学家
column3: e.g. [[Anthropologists]] study the origin, development, and functioning of human societies and cultures.

column2: [C, U] the state of being almost the same, or a particular way in which sth. is almost the same 相似性；类似性；相似处；相似点
column3: e.g. The police are checking for [[similarities]] with other recent attacks in the area.

column2: [C] a member of your family who lived a long time ago 祖先；祖宗
column3: e.g. Although I'm British myself, my [[ancestors]] were actually French.

column2: of, relating to, or inherited from an ancestor 祖先的
column3: e.g. The house is the [[ancestral]] home of Baron Stourton, but after the family moved out in the 1960s it fell into disrepair.

column2: (be ~ to do sth.; be ~ to sth.) be likely to do sth. or behave in a particular way 有做某事的意向；倾向于做某事
column3: e.g. They'll be more [[inclined]] to listen carefully if you don't shout.

column2: (only before noun) long or longer than usual or expected 较长时间的；延期的
column3: e.g. If you are going abroad for an [[extended]] period of time, you should consider renting your house out.

column2: (only before noun) based on experiments or experience rather than ideas or theories 以实验（经验）为依据的；经验主义的
column3: e.g. There is strong [[empirical]] evidence to suggest that these concerns are not trivial.

column2: [C, U] a good reason why sth. exists or is done 正当理由
column3: e.g. I can see no possible [[justification]] for your being late.

column2: have qualities, physical features, etc. that are similar to those of your parents, grandparents, etc. 经遗传获得（品质、身体特征等）
column3: e.g. Mr. Grass [[inherited]] his work ethic from his father.；e.g. He [[inherited]] a large sum of money from his grandmother about 10 years ago.

column2: receive money, property, etc. from sb. when they die 继承（金钱、财产等）
column3: e.g. Mr. Grass [[inherited]] his work ethic from his father.；e.g. He [[inherited]] a large sum of money from his grandmother about 10 years ago.

column2: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment 明智的；合理的；实际的；有判断力的
column3: e.g. People are far more [[sensible]] about what and how much they drink these days.

column2: have an effect on or concern a particular person, group, or situation 适用于；对···有效
column3: e.g. The offer only [[applies to]] flights from London and Manchester.

column2: whatever is needed to achieve sth. 不惜一切代价
column3: e.g. I have to avoid being late for work again [[at all costs]], or I'll lose my job.

column2: (BrE, spoken) immediately or without delay 立刻；马上
column3: e.g. I wrote him a letter and posted it [[straight away]].

column2: (also in … terms) used to show what aspects of a subject you are talking about or how you are thinking about it 谈及；就···而言；在···方面；从···方面来说
column3: e.g. It's a mistake to think of Florida only in terms of its tourist attractions.

column2: (also in respect of) (fml.) concerning or in relation to sth. 关于···；就···而言
column3: e.g. The two groups were similar with respect to income and status.

column2: similar to, or at the same level as sth. 与···相似；与···水平一致
column3: e.g. The new policy is [[in line with]] the plans that were discussed last year.

column2: [C] a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like 模式化的思想；老一套；旧框框
column3: e.g. Current evidence indicates that older people are more healthy than popular [[stereotypes]] suggest.

column2: [U] the fact of being important and well-known 重要；杰出；著名
column3: e.g. His rise to [[prominence]] would not have been possible without the war.

column2: 1) [U] feelings of pity, love, sadness, etc. that are often considered to be too strong or not suitable for a particular situation 多愁善感；感情因素
column3: e.g. He was overwhelmed by [[sentiment]] as he thought of his wife.；e.g. Public [[sentiment]] is against any change to the law.

column2: 2) [C, U] (fml.) an opinion or feeling you have about sth. 意见；观点；感想
column3: e.g. He was overwhelmed by [[sentiment]] as he thought of his wife.；e.g. Public [[sentiment]] is against any change to the law.

column2: having the qualities or appearance considered to be typical of women; connected with women （指气质或外貌）女性特有的；女性的
column3: e.g. Amelia's report describes the experience from a [[feminine]] point of view.

column2: connected with literature 文学的；文学上的
column3: e.g. In a [[literary]] essay, you should explore the meaning and construction of the text.

column2: having feelings that are typical of a caring mother toward a child 母性的；母亲般慈爱的
column3: e.g. She seems to have a strong [[maternal]] instinct.

column2: to a much greater level or degree than seems reasonable or appropriate 过度地；过多地
column3: e.g. The country relies [[excessively]] on borrowing from abroad.

column2: [C, U] the fact of being male or female 性别
column3: e.g. It is a country where [[gender]] roles have remained largely unchanged.

column2: [C, U] the unfair difference between groups of people in society, when some have more wealth, status, or opportunities than others 不平等；不平衡；不平均
column3: e.g. There has been an increase in economic [[inequality]] between different areas of the country.

column2: [U, sing.] an unfair personal opinion that influences your judgment 偏见；成见；偏心
column3: e.g. It's clear that the company has a [[bias]] against women.

column2: [C] a magazine, esp. one about a serious or technical subject 期刊
column3: e.g. Readers will find a complete list of [[periodicals]] dealing with that subject.

column2: [C, U] the act of printing a book, a magazine, etc. and making it available to the public; a book, a magazine, etc. that has been published （书刊等的）出版，发行；出版物
column3: e.g. That professor was the author of 70 major scientific [[publications]].

column2: examine or think about sth. carefully, in order to understand it 分析；剖析
column3: e.g. We use a special computer program to [[analyze]] all the sales figures.

column2: recognize and correctly name sb. / sth. 认出，识别（某人或某物）
column3: e.g. Passengers were asked to [[identify]] their own suitcases before they were put on the plane.

column2: [C, U] a statement, letter, etc. that shows that sth. is true, correct, or definite 证实；证明
column3: e.g. I'm still waiting for [[confirmation]] of the test results.

column2: acting or happening in a way that is expected 可预料的；可预见的
column3: e.g. In March and April, the weather in this area is much less [[predictable]].

column2: very unusual or surprising 异乎寻常的；令人惊奇的
column3: e.g. These myths have a [[startling]] likeness to one another.

column2: having a quality or characteristic that makes sth. different and easily noticed 特有的；特别的；有特色的
column3: e.g. Whatever you think of his poetry, it's certainly [[distinctive]].

column2: exactly the same, or very similar 完全相同的；极为相似的
column3: e.g. The picture is [[identical]] to the one in The Museum of Modern Art in New York.

column2: (only before noun) done in a planned and determined way, esp. by more than one person, government, country, etc. 齐心协力的；一致的
column3: e.g. Libraries have made a [[concerted]] effort to attract young people.

column2: [C] a serious speech or piece of writing on a particular subject （关于某主题的）演讲，论述，著述
column3: e.g. Hastings responds with a lengthy [[discourse]] on marketing strategies.

column2: (fml.) relating to amounts rather than to the quality or standard of sth. （数）量的；与数量有关的；定量的
column3: e.g. We need to do a proper [[quantitative]] analysis of this problem.

column2: [U] the fact of having sb. to speak, vote, or make decisions for you 代理；代表
column3: e.g. Minority groups need more effective parliamentary [[representation]].

column2: not serious, important, or valuable 微不足道的；没有什么价值的
column3: e.g. I know it sounds [[trivial]], but I'm worried about it.

column2: easy to see or notice; clear or definite 显著的；显而易见的
column3: e.g. Road noise tends to be more [[noticeable]] in certain weather conditions.

column2: 1) hide sth. or change it, so that it cannot be recognized 掩蔽；掩饰
column3: e.g. The speech was seen by many as a thinly [[disguised]] attack on the president.；e.g. He [[disguised]] himself by wearing a false beard.

column2: 2) change sb.'s appearance so that people cannot recognize them 装扮；假扮
column3: e.g. The speech was seen by many as a thinly [[disguised]] attack on the president.；e.g. He [[disguised]] himself by wearing a false beard.

column2: 1) (of feelings, thoughts, etc.) existing or happening without you realizing or being aware; not deliberate or controlled （感情、思想等）无意识的，未意识到的
column3: e.g. He seems to be driven by an [[unconscious]] desire to do better than everyone else.；e.g. They found him lying [[unconscious]] on the floor.

column2: 2) unable to see, move, feel, etc. in the normal way because you are not conscious 不省人事的；失去知觉的
column3: e.g. He seems to be driven by an [[unconscious]] desire to do better than everyone else.；e.g. They found him lying [[unconscious]] on the floor.

column2: [C] a person or company whose business is to arrange the writing, production, and sale of books, newspapers, etc. （书、报纸等的）出版者，出版商；出版社
column3: e.g. The [[publisher]] planned to produce the journal on a weekly basis.

column2: continue doing an activity or trying to achieve sth. over a long period of time 追求；继续进行
column3: e.g. Students should [[pursue]] their own interests, as well as do their school work.

column2: [U] the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way 歧视
column3: e.g. Laws have got to be tougher to stop [[discrimination]] against the disabled.

column2: etc.
column3: become important, famous, powerful, etc. 变得杰出、著名、强大等
column4: e.g. She played an important supporting role in the family as her husband [[rose to fame]] as an actor.

column2: at issue or in question 待解决的；成问题的
column3: e.g. His own personal future was [[at stake]].
